text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]f[/mathjaxinline] denote the polynomial [mathjaxinline]x^3 + 1[/mathjaxinline], and let [mathjaxinline]g[/mathjaxinline] denote the polynomial [mathjaxinline]x^2 - x[/mathjaxinline]. Recall that the set of polynomials is a vector space over [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R[/mathjaxinline], so [mathjaxinline]f[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]g[/mathjaxinline] are vectors in that vector space.

Let [mathjaxinline]h[/mathjaxinline] denote [mathjaxinline]17x^3 + 2x^2 - 2x + 17[/mathjaxinline]. Can you write [mathjaxinline]h[/mathjaxinline] as a linear combination [mathjaxinline]h = a_1 f + a_2 g[/mathjaxinline]? If so, enter possible values for [mathjaxinline]a_1[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]a_2[/mathjaxinline]. If not, enter No in both boxes.

Let [mathjaxinline]h[/mathjaxinline] denote [mathjaxinline]3x^4 + 3x[/mathjaxinline]. Can you write [mathjaxinline]h[/mathjaxinline] as a linear combination [mathjaxinline]h = a_1 f + a_2 g[/mathjaxinline]? If so, enter possible values for [mathjaxinline]a_1[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]a_2[/mathjaxinline]. If not, enter No in both boxes.
